name: Embassy Suites Detroit Metro Airport

reviews.title: Nice Stay
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel, It seems to be one I will frequent in the near future. My family really enjoyed the extra perks of the hotel. I really enjoyed the evening social hour witch allowed me to get to know others on my trip

reviews.title: Small room but lovely lobby with great breakfast.
reviews.text: We stayed one night before departing the next day on a flight. Our room had two double beds and a separate sitting area that was divided by folding doors. It was a small room and a bit dated but functional for one night. Breakfast in the morning was great with lots of choices including an omelette bar and lots of fresh fruit it was great.

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: A great place to stay perfect for early flights. The managers reception is a nice touch along with the complimentary breakfast. We use it for early flights with easy access to the airport. Parking is free as well the rooms were clean with a nice work out area. Pool was busy but expected.

reviews.title: Satisfactory, but not up to Embassy Suite expectations
reviews.text: I booked this hotel because I wanted something a cut above the standard fare. This hotel was satisfactory, but it didn't meet my expectations from other Embassy Suite experiences around the country. The air conditioner in the room was quite loud, and the planes were loud (though they quit flying in the late evening). The evening reception location was devoid of atmosphere (same goes for the breakfast location which was the same place). The morning breakfast was good -- I do enjoy having eggs cooked to order.

reviews.title: Best hotel I've every stayed in
reviews.text: Another thing was when I checked in. I stepped up to the desk at 2:50PM and was told check-in time was 3:00 and that I would have to wait till 3:00 when a room would be available. I found it hard to believe that no rooms were available and that they would all magically be ready 10 minutes later. When I pressed him for a room, he looked and found one. A hotel near an airport should do everything they can to accommodate "early" check-ins, and it seemed that the system at this hotel just wasn't set up with the customer in mind.

reviews.title: Down-at-the-Heels Property, But Friendly Staff
reviews.text: I only stayed one night.

reviews.title: Not impressed
reviews.text: I arrived late (9:45 pm), found my room. Needed a working fridge to keep some food items cool, but it was not to be. Improvised by getting ice from the ice machine down the hall and turning the fridge into an ice-chest. The ice machine had quite a bit of green-and-brown stuff growing in it, so I had to be careful none of the contaminated ice melted onto my food. Being as I'd had an early start (4:00 am), a long workday, and an early start scheduled for the next morning; I'd rather have spent my time sleeping.

reviews.title: Better Rooms Elsewhere for Less
reviews.text: Shaving the next morning was a bit of a trick, since the lights over the mirror wouldn't come on (they'd worked the night before). I found if you wiggled the switch a few dozen times they'd come on. OK for a Motel 6, but not for a Hilton.
On the plus side, every person I met was friendly and nice; they changed my opinion of Detroit. If only their property wasn't falling down around their ears.
reviews.title: Bad Hotel four **** No way!!
Special surprise!
reviews.text: Anybody who pays the standard rate of $165 per night is getting robbed. Our discount brought the price down to $107, but that's still too much for what you get here.

reviews.title: Not up to Hilton standards
reviews.text: Pros: good size rooms

reviews.title: okay stay
reviews.text: Cons: (many here!):

reviews.title: A good overnight stay.
reviews.text: 1. Booked rate via Hilton website inclusive of breakfast; only to find out that they offered a free breakfast. Since the breakfast inclusive rate was about $12 more, I thought it would be fair to give me the non-inclusive rate, since essentially I was paying for something that was free. I was told that since I had already checked in, the rate couldn't be changed....and I am a high level Hilton Honors card holder! So much for wanting to keep my business.

reviews.title: Hotel Is Well Kept!
reviews.text: 2. Halls were smelly and dark, there was a treadmill in the middle of one of them.

I stayed here 1 week on a business trip and the hotel was inexpensive and comfortable. The beds are pillow top and are comfortable plus you have a fridge and coffeemaker in the room. I would suggest bringing earplugs as it can be noisy due to being close to the airport and the staff dropping newspapers in the halls early in the morning. It was clean, comfortable and for the price of $110 a night, it was a great value. I have stayed in much worse for alot more money. If you are a starbucks fan you will be disappointment as the free coffee in the rooms is not very good but good luck in trying to find a starbucks within 10 miles of this location, you have to go to Dearborne.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean

reviews.text: We stayed one night before catching an early flight. Desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The suite was beautiful and spacious. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: They weren't kidding when they included "airport" in the name of this hotel. While the proximity was certainly convenient, the poor soundproofing made it seem like my room was on the runway! The building literally shook every time a plane was landing. I've stayed in many "airport" hotels, and have never experienced this level of noise. Check-in was a pain. I booked a king, non-smoking room. When I got to the assigned room, I could smell smoke in the hallway. The door did not have the non-smoking sign that many others did. When I tried the key, it did not work. After schlepping all the way back to the desk with my luggage (my room was as far from the desk as possible), they told me I had booked a smoking room. I produced my confirmation from the Hilton website that proved otherwise. Naturally, they did not have any non-smoking, king rooms left (why is this always such a problem?), so I got stuck with two doubles. The breakfast buffet was poorly stocked, and the staff was slow to replenish items as they ran out (example: no bacon for 40 minutes). If I have occasion to stay in the area again, I will definitely try a different hotel.
reviews.title: Bring Your Earplugs!
So-so
reviews.text: When we checked in on a Friday, mind you I had my 3 daughters (ranging in age from 10-15) with me. The front desk clerk was a little abrupt and curt with me. She spoke to me as if I was a second class 'ghetto' citizen. I am very well spoken and did not appreciate this. Another thing that I didn't like was that she gave me a policy to sign, stipulating that I couldn't bring liquor in the room, the room couldn't be occupied by more than the allotted people, no parties or get togethers, etc. I was extremely offended.

I am certain that they don't treat their business customers (i.e. Caucasian males) this way? I'm way too old to have a rambunctious hotel party. Although I rented two rooms for one night, it was only because my townhouse isn't large enough to accommodate 6 children. It was just a simple sleepover before they went back to school. No where on the Hilton website was I informed of such a policy. Had I known beforehand I would have gone elsewhere.
reviews.title: Home Comfort and Convenience
Great stay!
reviews.text: First of all, I've stayed in a lot of hotels and this one wins the award for Best Bathroom Mirror Lighting. Would every other hotel please take a look at this one? Wonderful!

reviews.title: Very Good
reviews.text: The hotel is definately dated, but our experience was a good one. Clean lobby and room, comfy bed, friendly staff, wonderful breakfast (delicious eggs), lovely pool and courtyard, nice evening reception (bring back a pizza with you and make it dinner). I think my only complaint was that every morning during breakfast they would clean the lobby restroom and take it out of commission when several people wanted to use it.

reviews.title: Bad Pool and TV experience
reviews.text: We were a little uncertain when we drove up to the hotel because it appears very dated and a little sketchy on the outside, but the inside is very nice. This was our first time staying at an Embassy Suites (usually stay at Homewoods and Hilton's) and I think we will consider Embassy's in the future.

reviews.title: Unbeatable Priceline rate for 3 rooms for our family annual "girls weekend" Detroit area!
reviews.text: This was a very nice hotel with excellent customer service. If I were to visit the area again I would stay at this location. I have always loved staying at a Embassy Suites for their service and the mangers happy hour and of course the cook to order breakfast.

reviews.title: Quick trip - good property
reviews.text: I took my family there to swim in the pool and watch movies on the TV. The pool was dirty and had globs of hair floating in it, leaves, and other unidentified items. The pool area was dirty from the night before; the floor and tables. The TV was not in working condition; a number of the channels were blurry and would not come in and we were not able to order movies because it was not working properly. However, with all of that the staff was very friendly.

My family and I stayed at three different rooms in three hotels in Detroit in July and August. First we stayed one night at Embassy suites close to Detroit Metro airport, then Residence Inn by Marriott Troy in Madison Heights and finally Fairfield Inn and Suites in Farmington Hills
reviews.title: Three hotels in Detroit

reviews.text: Something that was unknown to me before travelling to Detroit was that there are perhaps tens of districts and small cities in Detroit. Trip advisor does not help for those of us Europeans who do not know this and search for hotels in “Detroit” only. There are also many hotels from the same chain in each county making it all very confusing.
reviews.title: Worth it if you have a coupon. Everything is good, just a little expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night at Embassy suites before renting a car and going to Toronto. My info from Embassy suites is therefore very limited. The hotel was old and at 4 am suddenly the fire alarm went off. No explanations to the reason and you can guess how we felt travelling from Sweden. The hotel pool is both indoor and connected to outdoor. The water in the pool was cold and not cleaned. Breakfast was good and with multiple choices. You can have your omelet made for you. Rooms were old. I loved the small garden as it was the first time in my life I saw a humming bird close to me. Our room faced ventilations and was really noisy. This hotel has free shuttles to the airport. The shuttles for all hotels are close and call the hotel after you passed through all controls because it juts takes the driver 10 minutes to come to the airport.
reviews.title: Showing Its Age

reviews.text: After coming back from Toronto we stayed at Residence Inn for 13 nights. We had booked this hotel via Hotels.com for three weeks and though we booked with possibility of cancellation we misunderstood that we can even shorten our visit. This was due to problem with hotels.com info. This hotel is old and in desperate need of renovation. The breakfast is ok but the breakfast lady during weekdays makes very watery waffle batter and stops you from using the machine. The housekeeping is the worse I have seen in US. Despite the house manager whose name I have forgotten promised to check our two rooms, they were not cleaned by any standards. Everyday shampoos or something was missing and we had to go and ask for it. The pool is outside and cold and in contrast to the other two hotels there is no Jacuzzi. There is however a gas grill and basket field. No gyms. The price for laundry is higher than Fairfield Inn. The TVs are not working. Nine of the channels were having problems. Having a small kid made all the difference and therefore we moved. We talked several times to the manager and he could not fix it. At the end we asked for discount and he discounted one night which we thought was two low, basically meaning 3% for the two rooms we had rented. We therefore moved to Fairfield where the hotel was better and 30 dollars per night cheaper! This hotel is the only one with kitchen.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Detroit

reviews.text: We checked several other hotels. One was Fairfield Inn which was much closer to where we wanted to go. Sylvia at the reception was extremely friendly and helpful. The water temperature in the pool was very pleasant, the type you just can get into without needing to warm up. There is jacuzzi and good breakfast with few more choices though not like Embassy suites. No free dinner on some nights like Residence Inn. Clean and quite rooms. This hotel is not available on hotels.com. Enough breakfast place unlike Residence Inn. None of the hotels have in room safes, which was not nice. All had very fast internet connection.
reviews.title: pretty good hotel for business
Awful
reviews.text: overpriced-run down-carpet was dirty-high speed internet was extra-the thermostat required an hvac degree to figure out-i have no idea how to get it to work-i can't believe the hilton puts their name on this hotel

reviews.title: Wow!!
reviews.text: Had to stay an extra night and was unable to stay at Marriott so I gave the HIlton a try.

reviews.title: Recently Renovated for the Better+ Still A Great Place To Stay By The Airport!
reviews.text: Great service and comped cookies and snacks dropped at your door.

This is my 7th Stay at this property......We stayed there on the night of the 16th of Febuary for an early departure the next day... The Hilton Suites Is Very Well Kept up. The staff was really frindly. The pool was nice- indor/outdor-nice temprature. We didn't stay for the Breakfest but we got drink cards in exchage for the breakfest cupons... Only problem was the room was that it was a little small for four people. Fitness Center & the pool was nice...... I thought the hotel was well worth the money. I'll tell you this is one of the nicest hotel in the Romulus area besides the Westin.....By the way this hotel was renovated sice I last there which was a year ago...
reviews.title: One night at Hilton Suites
Pleasantly surprised!
reviews.text: You can call up there.....If you have the entertaiment card they will give you a awsome price for the room $95.00 for us that night.......Ask for a manager...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid the extra to stay at an Embassy Suites but was disappointed in this location. There was no atrium. The reception fare was chips and pub mix and finally they brought out a vegetable tray. Breakfast was not very satisfying. The oatmeal was very thick but did have nice toppings to add. The French toast was tasteless. The rooms were clean and nice but the air conditioner was loud and when it cyclical off, the room got warm. You could also hear other guests in the hallway even when in the bedroom. The shower area needed to be remodeled with no obvious vent working in the area. They did use energy bulbs in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Not up to expected Embassy Suites standards

reviews.text: I would not go the extra funds to return.
reviews.title: great

reviews.text: A great place to stay every two weeks. I use this facility for business and it located near the airport anc convienent to my training facility. The morning "cook to order" breakfast is the best! Michelle really takes care of her guests.
reviews.title: Escellent Place to Stay

reviews.text: We stayed there because our daughter went to Germany for her Michigan Lions All State Band. The shuttle brought us to the right gate where my daughter was returning and picked us up right after we called them. The staff and room were very nice and the kids raved about the breakfast choices. We had a wonderful time in Detroit, even though we got lost, but found our way out. It was a lot of fun.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms and staff

reviews.text: Another airport hotel, in some respects better than The Courtyard (just across the street).
reviews.title: Best Stay Ever

aka: Embassy Suites Detroit Metro Airport Hotel
description: Embassy Suites Detroit Metro Airport covers all the basics: convenience, comfortable surroundings, and great amenities. Our newly renovated luxurious property caters to everyones needs. Our spacious two room suites feature all the comforts of home. Additionally, Deli Cafe and Lounge offers casual dining in a bistro atmosphere.
